Definition: Unique identifier for the loan.
Reporting (snapshot) date on which all loan metrics and statuses are calculated.
Number of days since the loan sale date (SALE_DATE).
Cumulative amount paid by the customer up to the reporting date, excluding adjustments.
Total amount the customer is expected to have paid by the reporting date based on loan terms.
Outstanding loan balance after accounting for payments, adjustments, discounts, and deposits.
Number of days the customer is behind on payments when arrears exist.
Final balance for reporting; set to zero if the loan is paid off, otherwise equals BALANCE.
Amount the customer has paid ahead of schedule relative to expected payments.
Net payment position of the customer; positive indicates advance, negative indicates arrears.
Amount the customer is behind on payments as of the reporting date.
High-level payment status: advance, up to date, or Arrears.
Indicator showing whether a payment activity occurred on the reporting date.
Payment amount expected for the reporting period based on the repayment schedule.
First payment amount made by the customer after loan activation.
Expected amount for the first scheduled repayment after sale.
Detailed credit status classification (e.g. Active, FPD, FMD, Inactive, Blocked, Paid Off, Return).
High-level portfolio grouping derived from L1 statuses (e.g. Active, FPD, PAR 7, PAR 30, Paid Off).
Date the device was returned by the customer, if applicable.
Loan origination date when the device was sold.
Result or status of the credit check performed at onboarding.
Regular payment amount recorded on the reporting date.
Adjustment applied to the loan balance on the reporting date (positive or negative).
Amount paid in advance, typically recorded at or before the sale date.
Upfront payment made by the customer at loan origination.
Scheduled weekly repayment amount for the loan.
Date when the credit term is expected to end based on payments made.
Next scheduled repayment due date.
Discount applied to the loan or cash price.
Amount paid in excess of the total expected loan obligation.
Most recent date on which a payment was recorded for the loan.
Initial payment made at the start of the loan, including deposit and early payments.
Total payments plus adjustments made within the first 15 days of loan activation, used for default classification logic.
